DOC.brief_summary: The main aim is to conduct a pilot field test of a group-based depression and adherence counseling intervention with HIV-infected women in the perinatal period. Participants will be HIV-infected women living in KwaZulu-Natal, South Africa.
DOC.brief_title: Support for Perinatal Adherence and Depression
DOC.detailed_description: The main aim of this study is to conduct a pilot field test of a group-based counseling intervention with HIV-infected women in the perinatal period as delivered by a lay counselor. The primary goal of the intervention is to reduce symptoms of perinatal depression and increase adherence to antiretroviral therapy among HIV-infected women during pregnancy and the postpartum period.
DOC.criteria: Currently pregnant HIVinfected and diagnosed with HIV during the index pregnancy Meet criteria for a major depressive episode Currently on antiretroviral therapy Receiving antenatal care at PMMH Gateway clinic Primary language English or isiZulu Access to a phone and willing to give researchers permission to reach them via phone Resident of Umlazi Unable or unwilling to provide informed consent Active untreated, major mental illness (untreated psychosis, bipolar disorder, dementia, or active suicidality) that would interfere with study participation Less than 18 years of age
